inclusion.criterion: histologically proven supratentorial malignant primary gliomas
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: unequivocal evidence for tumor recurrence or progression by MRI or CT scan
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: recent resection of recurrent or progressive tumor
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: recovered from the effects of surgery
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: evaluable disease following resection of recurrent tumor
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: interval of greater than or equal to 4 weeks from the completion of radiation therapy to study entry
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: recovered from the toxic effects of prior therapy
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: concurrent use of other investigational agents
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: disease that will obscure toxicity or dangerously alter drug metabolism
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: significant illness that in the investigator's opinion cannot be adequately controlled with appropriate therapy or would compromise the patients ability to tolerate this therapy
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: prior therapy with Peg-Intron or Thalidomide
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 45-year-old man with a history of anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine complicated by severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention s/p Foley catheter, high-dose steroids, hypertension, and chronic pain.
